intro: Chaetanthera tenella, commonly known as the slender chaetanthera, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, greenish-white flowers. The plant has finely divided, fern-like leaves that are aromatic when crushed, a trait common in the Apiaceae family. It typically grows in moist, sandy soils along stream banks and in open woodlands. Chaetanthera tenella is often found in shaded to partially sunny environments and is known for its delicate appearance and ecological importance to local pollinators.
